en_question:
A candy factory uses raw materials A, B, and C to produce three different brands of candy: Brand X, Brand Y, and Brand Z. The content proportions of A, B, and C in each brand, the costs of the raw materials, the monthly usage limits for each raw material, as well as the unit processing cost and selling price of each candy brand are shown in Table 1-17.The question is: How many kilograms of each brand of candy should the factory produce each month in order to maximize its profit?Please formulate a linear programming mathematical model for this problem.

    \centering
    \caption{Raw Materials and Candy Production Data}
    \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.2}
    \begin{tabular}{c|ccc|c|c}
        \toprule
        Raw Materials & X & Y & Z & Raw Material Cost(dollar/kg) & Monthly Usage Limit(kg) \\
        \midrule
        A & $\geq 60\%$ & $\geq 30\%$ & & 2.00 & 2000 \\
        B & & & & 1.50 & 2500 \\
        C & $\leq 20\%$ & $\leq 50\%$ & $\leq 60\%$ & 1.00 & 1200 \\
        \midrule
        Processing Cost(dollar/kg) & 0.50 & 0.40 & 0.30 & & \\
        Selling Price(dollar/kg) & 3.40 & 2.85 & 2.25 & & \\
        \bottomrule
    \end{tabular}
\end{table}

en_question:
A livestock farm raises animals for sale. It is required that each animal must receive at least 700g of protein, 30g of minerals, and 100mg of vitamins per day. There are five types of feed available for selection. The nutritional content per kilogram and the unit price of each type of feed are shown in Table 1-22.

\begin{table}[h]
    \centering
    \caption{Nutritional Content and Price of Feed}
    \renewcommand{\arraystretch}{1.2}
    \begin{tabular}{c|c|c|c|c}
        \toprule
        Feed & Protein (g) & Minerals (g) & Vitamins (mg) & Price (dollar/kg) \\
        \midrule
        1 & 3 & 1.0 & 0.5 & 0.2 \\
        2 & 2 & 0.5 & 1.0 & 0.7 \\
        3 & 1 & 0.2 & 0.2 & 0.4 \\
        4 & 6 & 2.0 & 2.0 & 0.3 \\
        5 & 18 & 0.5 & 0.8 & 0.8 \\
        \bottomrule
    \end{tabular}
\end{table}

The goal is to determine a feed selection plan that both meets the nutritional requirements for animal growth and minimizes the cost.

en_question:
Hongyin Company has committed to providing the following loan amounts at the beginning of each year for a construction project over a period of four years starting from 2003:
\begin{itemize}
    \item Year 2003 — 100 thousand dollars
    \item Year 2004 — 150 thousand dollars
    \item Year 2005 — 120 thousand dollars
    \item Year 2006 — 110 thousand dollars
\end{itemize}

 All the above loan funds must be raised before the end of 2002. However, in order to make full use of the funds, any surplus (after meeting the annual loan amounts) can be invested in the following projects:

\begin{enumerate}
    \item At the beginning of 2003, purchase Bond A, with a term of 3 years. Upon maturity, the total return (principal and interest) will be 140\% of the investment. The purchase is limited to 60 thousand dollars. 
    \item At the beginning of 2003, purchase Bond B, with a term of 2 years. Upon maturity, the total return (principal and interest) will be 125\% of the investment. The purchase is limited to 90 thousand dollars. 
    \item At the beginning of 2004, purchase Bond C, with a term of 2 years. Upon maturity, the total return (principal and interest) will be 130% of the investment. The purchase is limited to 50 thousand dollars. 
    \item At the beginning of each year, any amount of surplus funds may be deposited in a bank account at an annual interest rate of 4%, with withdrawal at the end of the same year. 
\end{enumerate}

 Question:How should Hongyin Company utilize the raised funds to ensure that the total amount needed to be raised at the end of 2002 is minimized?
cn_question:
宏银公司承诺为某建设项目从 2003 年起的 4 年中每年年初分别提供以下数额贷款：
\begin{itemize}
    \item 2003 年——100 万元
    \item 2004 年——150 万元
    \item 2005 年——120 万元
    \item 2006 年——110 万元
\end{itemize}

以上贷款资金均需于 2002 年底前筹集。但为了充分发挥这笔资金的作用，在满足每年贷款额情况下，可将多余资金分别用于下列投资项目：

\begin{enumerate}
    \item 于 2003 年年初购买 A 种债券，期限 3 年，到期后本息合计为投资额的 140\%，但限购 60 万元；
    \item 于 2003 年年初购买 B 种债券，期限 2 年，到期后本息合计为投资额的 125\%，但限购 90 万元；
    \item 于 2004 年年初购买 C 种债券，期限 2 年，到期后本息合计为投资额的 130\%，但限购 50 万元；
    \item 于每年年初将任意数额的资金存放于银行，年息 4\%，于每年年底取出。
\end{enumerate}

求宏银公司应如何运用好这笔筹集到的资金，使 2002 年底需筹集的资金数额最少。

en_question:
At the beginning of the year, Hongdou Garment Factory launched a new fashion product. Based on experience and market research, the predicted demand for this product over the next six months is as follows: 
 January:3,000 units, February:3,600 units, March:4,000 units, April: 4,600 units, May:4,800 units, June:5,000 units 
 Each unit requires 4 hours of skilled labor and 150 dollars worth of raw materials to produce. The selling price is 240 dollars per unit. 
 At the beginning of January, the factory has 80 skilled workers, each working 160 hours per month. To meet production needs, the factory can recruit and train new workers. Training a new worker takes 50 hours of a skilled worker’s time for instruction, and the training period lasts one month, after which the trainee can become a skilled worker. Skilled workers are paid 2,000 dollars per month. Trainees receive a living allowance of 800 dollars during the training month. After completing training, new workers receive the same salary and work efficiency as skilled workers. Each month, 2\% of skilled workers (including those newly trained and on the job for at least one month) leave due to various reasons. 
 The factory starts the year with 400 units of inventory and requires that the ending inventory in June not exceed 100 units. Additionally, if garments are not delivered in the month of production, they incur a storage cost of 10 dollars per unit per month. Design a labor and production plan for the factory that satisfies the monthly and end-of-June inventory requirements, while maximizing the total revenue from January to June.
cn_question:
红豆服装厂新推出一款时装，根据经验和市场调查，预测今后6个月对该款时装的需求为：
1 月——3 000 件，2 月——3 600 件，3 月——4 000 件，4 月——4 600 件，5 月——4 800 件，6 月——5 000 件。
生产每件需熟练工人工作 4h，耗用原材料 150 元。售价为 240 元/件。该厂 1 月初有熟练工 80 人，每人每月工作 160h。为适应生产需要，该厂可招收新工人培训，
但培训一名新工人需占用熟练工人 50h 用于指导操作，培训期为一个月，结束后即可上岗。
熟练工人每月工资 2 000 元，新工人培训期给予生活补贴 800 元，转正后工资与生产效率同熟练工人。
又熟练工人（含转正一个月后的新工人）每月有 2\% 因各种原因离职。已知该厂年初加工出 400 件该款时装作为库存，
要求 6 月末库存不超过 100 件。又每月生产出来的时装如不在当月交货，库存费用为每件每月 10 元。
试为该厂设计一个满足月及 6 月末存货要求，又使 1—6 月总收入为最大的劳动与生产方案。

en_question:
A cargo ship has three compartments: front, middle, and rear. Their volumes and maximum allowable loads are shown in \ref{table1-24}. 
 There are three types of cargo to be shipped, with data shown in  \ref{table1-25}.

\begin{table}[h]
    \centering
    \caption{Maximum Allowable Load and Volume}
    \label{table1-24}
    \begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|}
        \hline
        \textbf{Item} & \textbf{Front Compartment} & \textbf{Middle Compartment} & \textbf{Rear Compartment} \\
        \hline
        Max Allowable Load (t) & 2000 & 3000 & 1500 \\
        \hline
        Volume ($m^3$) & 4000 & 5000 & 1500 \\
        \hline
    \end{tabular}
\end{table}

\begin{table}[h]
    \centering
    \caption{Cargo Data}
    \label{table1-25}
    \begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|c|c|}
        \hline
        \textbf{Cargo Type} & \textbf{Quantity (pieces)} & \textbf{Volume per Piece ($m^3$/piece)} & \textbf{Weight per Piece (t/piece)} & \textbf{Freight Rate (dollar/piece)} \\
        \hline
        A & 600 & 10 & 8 & 1000 \\
        \hline
        B & 1000 & 5 & 6 & 700 \\
        \hline
        C & 800 & 7 & 4 & 600 \\
        \hline
    \end{tabular}
\end{table}

 For maritime safety, the actual load weight in the front, middle, and rear compartments must maintain roughly the same proportion as their respective maximum allowable loads. 
 Specifically: The load weight ratios between the front/middle and rear/middle compartments must not deviate by more than 15\% from the ratios of their respective max allowable loads. The ratio between front and rear compartments must not deviate by more than 10\%. 
 Question: How many pieces of cargo A, B, and C should be loaded in total to maximize revenue, while meeting the volume, weight, and balance constraints? 
 Please formulate the linear programming model for this problem.

en_question:
A company has decided to use 1000 thousand yuan of a new product development fund to invest in the development of three new products: A, B, and C. Forecasted return on investment (ROI) for each product is: Product A: 5%, Product B: 7%, Product C: 10%, Due to associated risks, the company has defined the following priority constraints: 1.At least 300 thousand yuan must be invested in Product A. 2.To diversify investment risk, no single product may receive more than 35% of the total fund. 3.At least 10% of the fund (i.e., 1 million yuan) must be reserved for emergency use.4.The objective is to maximize total profit from the investment. 
Please formulate a model to maximize the total investment profit(in thousand yuan).
cn_question:
公司决定使用1000万元新产品开发基金开发A、B、C三种新产品。经预测估计,开发A、B、C三种新产品的投资利润率分别为5%、7%、10%。由于新产品开发有一定风险,公司研究后确定了下列优先顺序目标:
第一,A产品至少投资300万元; 第二,为分散投资风险,任何一种新产品的开发投资不超过开发基金总额的35%;第三,应至少留有10%的开发基金，以备急用;第四,使总的投资利润最大。
请建立模型使总的投资利润最大

已知单位牛奶、牛肉、鸡蛋中的维生素及胆固醇含量等有关数据见表 4-15。如果只考虑这三种食物，并且设立了下列三个目标：

en_question: \noindent\textbf{5.12 Truck Delivery Problem (Set Covering Problem)} Longyun Company must currently deliver goods to 5 customers: 1 unit of goods to Customer A, 2 units to Customer B, 3 units to Customer C, 4 units to Customer D, 8 units to Customer E. The company has 4 trucks, each used only once: Truck 1: capacity of 2 units, Truck 2: capacity of 6 units, Truck 3: capacity of 8 units, Truck 4: capacity of 11 units. The cost of using truck j is c_j. Constraints: A truck cannot deliver to both Customer A and Customer C. A truck cannot deliver to both Customer B and Customer D. Objective:Formulate an integer programming model to determine how to assign the deliveries to the trucks to minimize the total transportation cost.
cn_question:
\noindent\textbf{5.12 卡车送货问题（覆盖问题）} 龙运公司目前必须向 5 家用户送货，
需在用户 A 处卸下 1 个单位重量的货物，在用户 B 处卸下 2 个单位重量的货物，
在用户 C 处卸下 3 个单位重量的货物，在用户 D 处卸下 4 个单位重量的货物，
在用户 E 处卸下 8 个单位重量的货物。公司有各种卡车四辆：
1 号车载重能力为 2 个单位，2 号车载重能力为 6 个单位，
3 号车载重能力为 8 个单位，4 号车载重能力为 11 个单位。
每辆车只运输一次，卡车 $j$ 的一次运费为 $c_j$。
假定一辆卡车不能同时给用户 A 和 C 送货；同样，也不能同时给用户 B 和 D 送货。
请列出一个整数规划模型表达式，以确定装送全部货物应如何配置卡车，使其运费最小。

en_question:
A hospital operates 24 hours a day, and the number of nurses needed in each time period is as follows: $2\!:\!00\!\sim\!6\!:\!00\!\longrightarrow\!10$ nurses, $6\!:\!00\!\sim$ 10:00\!\longrightarrow\!15$ nurses, $10:00\!\sim\!14:00\!\longrightarrow\!25$ nurses, $14:00\!\sim\!18\!:\!00\!\longrightarrow\!20$ nurses, $18\,;00\!\sim\!22\!:\!00\!\longrightarrow\!18$ nurses,$22\!:\!00\!\sim\!2\!:\!00\!-\!\!\!-\!12$ nurses. Nurses are scheduled in 6 shifts, starting at: $2:00\,,6:00\,,10:00\,,14:00\,,18:00\,,22:00$ and each nurse works 8 consecutive hours.

Task:Determine the minimum number of nurses the hospital needs to schedule in total in order to meet the staffing requirements.

A hospital operates 24 hours a day. The number of nurses required during each 4-hour shift is:$2\!:\!00\!\sim\!6\!:\!00\!\longrightarrow\!10$ nurses, $6\!:\!00\!\sim$ 10:00\!\longrightarrow\!15$ nurses, $10:00\!\sim\!14:00\!\longrightarrow\!25$ nurses, $14:00\!\sim\!18\!:\!00\!\longrightarrow\!20$ nurses, $18\,;00\!\sim\!22\!:\!00\!\longrightarrow\!18$ nurses, $22\!:\!00\!\sim\!2\!:\!00\!-\!\!\!-\!12$ nurses. Nurses work in 6 shifts, each starting at: $2:00\,,6:00\,,10:00\,,14:00\,,18:00\,,22:00$ and each nurse works 8 consecutive hours. 

Now there’s a new scenario: The hospital can hire both full-time and temporary (contract) nurses. Both types work the same 8-hour shifts. Wages: Full-time nurse = ¥10/hour. Contract nurse = ¥15/hour. Task:Should the hospital hire contract nurses? If so, how many should be hired in each shift to minimize total labor cost, while still satisfying the required nurse coverage?

en_question: 1.34 The market demand for products I and II is as follows: Product I requires 10,000 units per month from January to April, 30,000 units per month from May to September, and 100,000 units per month from October to December. Product II requires 15,000 units per month from March to September, and 50,000 units per month in other months.The production costs of the factory for the two products are: For product I: 5 yuan per unit if produced from January to May; 4.50 yuan per unit if produced from June to December. For product II: 8 yuan per unit if produced from January to May; 7 yuan per unit if produced from June to December. The total monthly production capacity of the factory for both products must not exceed 120,000 units. The volume per unit is 0.2 m³ for product I and 0.4 m³ for product II, and the factory’s warehouse volume capacity is 15,000 m³. Requirements:(a) Show that the above problem has no feasible solution.(b) If the factory’s warehouse is insufficient, storage space can be rented from an external factory. If using the in-house warehouse, the cost per m³ per month is 1 yuan; if renting from an external warehouse, the cost increases to 1.5 yuan per m³ per month. Under the condition of meeting market demand, determine how the factory should schedule production to minimize the total cost of production and inventory storage.
cn_question: 1.34市场对I、Ⅱ两种产品的需求量为：产品I在1～4月每月需10000件，5～9月每月30000件,10～12月每月100000件；产品Ⅱ在3～9月每月15000件，其他月每月50000件。某厂生产这两种产品成本为：产品I在1～5月内生产每件5元，6～12月内生产每件4.50元；产品Ⅱ在1～5月内生产每件8元,6～12月内生产每件7元。该厂每月生产两种产品能力总和应不超过120000件。产品I体积每件0.2 m”，产品Ⅱ每件0.4立方米，而该厂仓库容积为 $15000\;\mathrm{~m^{3}~}$ 。要求：（a）说明上述问题无可行解；（b）若该厂仓库不足时，可从外厂租借。若占用本厂每月每m²库容需1元,而租用外厂仓库时上述费用增加为1.5元,试问在满足市场需求情况下,该厂应如何安排生产,使总的生产成本加库存费用为最少。

en_question: 5.25 A master’s student majoring in Operations Research at a university is required to choose from the following seven courses: Calculus, Operations Research, Data Structures, Managerial Statistics, Computer Simulation, Computer Programming, and Forecasting. Among these, the student must select two Mathematics courses, two Operations Research courses, and two Computer Science courses. Some courses belong to only one category: Calculus is a Mathematics course, and Computer Programming is a Computer Science course. However, some courses span multiple categories: Operations Research counts as both Operations Research and Mathematics; Data Structures belong to both Computer Science and Mathematics; Managerial Statistics belong to both Mathematics and Operations Research; Computer Simulation belongs to both Computer Science and Operations Research; Forecasting belongs to both Operations Research and Mathematics. If a course falls into two categories, selecting it counts as one course in each of those two categories.In addition, some courses have prerequisites: to take Computer Simulation or Data Structures, one must first take Computer Programming; to take Managerial Statistics, one must first take Calculus; and to take Forecasting, one must first take Managerial Statistics.Question: What is the minimum number of courses a master’s student must take, and which courses must be taken, in order to meet the above requirements?

en_question: A company goes to a university to recruit one graduating student majoring in management. From many applicants, three candidates are shortlisted for interviews, to be interviewed one by one. The interview rules are as follows: When interviewing the first or second candidate: If satisfied (scored 3 points), and the decision is to hire, the interviews end immediately. If not satisfied (scored 1 point), the candidate is rejected and the interview continues with the next person. If somewhat satisfied (scored 2 points), there are two choices: either hire the candidate and stop the interviews, or reject and continue the interviews. However, once a candidate is rejected, they cannot be recalled later even after seeing other candidates. If both the first and second candidates are rejected, then the third candidate must be hired regardless of their score. Based on past experience: The probability of a candidate being satisfactory is 20%, Somewhat satisfactory is 50%, Unsatisfactory is 30%. Goal: Determine a hiring strategy that maximizes the expected score of the hired candidate.

The production cost for A is x^2, where x is the quantity of A produced in that month. The inventory holding cost is 1 yuan per unit per month. The demand for the 3 months is estimated as: d_1 = 100, d_2 = 110, d_3 = 120. Assume that: The starting inventory at the beginning of the first month is s_0 = 0, The ending inventory at the end of the third month is s_3 = 0. Question: What should be the monthly production quantities in order to minimize the total production and inventory costs?
cn_question: 7.16某厂准备连续3个月生产A种产品,每月初开始生产。A的生产成本费为 $x^{2}$ 其中 $x$ 是A产品当月的生产数量。仓库存货成本费是每月每单位为1元。估计3个月的需求量分别为 $d_{\mathrm{l}}=100$ ， $d_{2}=110$ ， $d_{\mathrm{3}}=120$ 。现设开始时第一个月月初存货 $s_{0}\!=\!0$ ,第三个月的月末存货 $s_{3}\!=\!0$ 。试问：每月的生产数量应是多少,才使总的生产和存货费用为最小?

 where $x_{1} and x_{2}$ represent the quantities produced of Product A and Product B, respectively. Question: If the machine must operate 5 hours per day, how many units of A and B should be produced to maximize total profit?
